title: PDF/Manual Knowledge Extraction Engine
brief: Extract machining knowledge from PDF manuals, technical documents, and catalogs.

phases.title: PDF/Manual Knowledge Extraction Engine
phases.description: Build a complete pipeline to ingest PDF manuals and technical documents, extract tables/charts/parameters, parse machining practices, map to knowledge schema, and validate against physics. Covers catalog data, tooling recommendations, and manufacturer specifications.

units.title: PDF Ingestion Pipeline
exit_conditions: pdf_ingestion.py accepts PDF file paths and URLs
Text extraction handles single-column, multi-column, and mixed layouts
OCR fallback for scanned PDFs via Tesseract integration
Page segmentation classifies regions as text, table, figure, header/footer
Metadata extraction: title, author, date, page count, document type
Handles PDFs up to 500 pages without memory overflow
Build passes
Tests pass with 5+ sample PDFs of varying formats

steps.instruction: Create cad-engine/src/extraction/ directory structure for all CC-EXT-MS1 modules
Build pdf_ingestion.py: PDF loading (file path + URL), text extraction via PyMuPDF primary + pdfplumber fallback, OCR path via Tesseract for scanned pages
Implement page segmentation: classify regions as text/table/figure/header/footer using layout analysis heuristics (column detection, whitespace analysis, ruling line detection)
Add metadata extraction (title, author, date, document type classification: manual/catalog/datasheet/technical-note)
Write tests: 5+ PDFs covering single-column manual, multi-column catalog, scanned document, mixed text+table, large (100+ page) document

deliverables.description: PDF loading, text extraction, OCR fallback, page segmentation
Extraction package init
Tests for PDF ingestion across format variants
Sample PDFs for testing (5+ documents)

units.title: Table and Chart Extraction
entry_conditions: camelot-py or tabula-py installed for table extraction
exit_conditions: table_extractor.py extracts tables from PDFs with >90% cell accuracy on test set
Handles merged cells, multi-line cells, headerless tables
chart_extractor.py extracts data from bar charts, line graphs, scatter plots
Extracted tables output as structured DataFrames with column headers
Chart data output as (x, y) series with axis labels and units
Unit detection for table columns (mm, in, RPM, m/min, etc.)
Build passes
Tests pass

steps.instruction: Build table_extractor.py: detect table boundaries using camelot (lattice + stream modes), extract cell contents, reconstruct grid structure, handle merged cells and multi-line cells
Add header inference: detect header rows (bold, separator lines, repeated patterns), assign column names, handle headerless tables with positional heuristics
Add unit detection for table columns: parse column headers and cell values for engineering units (mm, in, RPM, m/min, SFM, IPR, IPT, HRC, Ra, etc.)
Build chart_extractor.py: detect chart regions from page segmentation, extract data points from bar/line/scatter plots using image analysis, capture axis labels and units
Write tests: speed/feed tables from Machinery's Handbook format, tooling catalogs with merged cells, cutting data charts

deliverables.description: Table detection, extraction, header inference, unit parsing
Chart/graph data extraction with axis label parsing
Tests for table and chart extraction accuracy

units.title: Technical Parameter Parsing
entry_conditions: prism_calc available for unit conversion validation
exit_conditions: param_parser.py extracts cutting parameters: speed, feed, DOC, WOC, RPM, chipload
Unit normalization: all values converted to SI base + imperial equivalents
Range detection: parses 'X-Y', 'X to Y', 'X~Y', 'min X max Y' patterns
Material-conditional parameters: links params to material grades (e.g., 'for 4140 steel: ...')
Tool-conditional parameters: links params to tool types/sizes
Tolerance parsing: extracts +/- values, fits/clearances
Build passes
Tests pass

steps.instruction: Build param_parser.py: regex + NLP patterns for cutting parameters (speed, feed, DOC, WOC, RPM, chipload, stepover, step-down)
Implement unit normalization: detect input units, convert to SI (m/min, mm/rev, mm) and imperial (SFM, IPR, in), store both representations
Implement range detection: parse range patterns ('100-200 SFM', '0.005 to 0.010 IPR', 'min 80 max 120 m/min'), output as (min, typical, max) tuples
Add conditional parameter linking: associate extracted params with material context (grade, hardness) and tool context (type, diameter, flute count, coating)
Add tolerance parsing: +/- values, H7/g6 fit notation, surface finish (Ra, Rz), GD&T callouts
Write tests using known Machinery's Handbook values and tooling catalog specifications

deliverables.description: Technical parameter extraction, unit normalization, range detection
Tests for parameter parsing against known reference values

units.title: Machining Practice Extraction
exit_conditions: practice_extractor.py identifies machining practice sections in text
Extracts structured practices: setup procedures, fixturing guidance, cutting strategies, coolant recommendations
Captures conditional logic: 'when machining X, do Y' patterns
Extracts safety warnings and constraints
Links practices to specific operations (turning, milling, drilling, grinding, EDM)
Confidence scoring per extracted practice based on source specificity
Build passes
Tests pass

steps.instruction: Build practice_extractor.py: NLP-based section identification for machining practices (setup, fixturing, strategy, coolant, safety)
Implement structured practice extraction: parse procedural text into step sequences with parameters, tools, and conditions
Add conditional logic extraction: identify 'when/if X then Y' patterns, material-dependent recommendations, machine-dependent adjustments
Extract safety warnings and hard constraints (max RPM, min coolant pressure, mandatory PPE, never-do items)
Add operation type classification and practice-to-operation linking
Implement confidence scoring: higher for specific quantitative advice, lower for vague/general guidance

deliverables.description: Machining practice extraction with conditional logic and safety warnings
Tests for practice extraction from manual text

units.title: Catalog Data Extraction
entry_conditions: prism_data tool DB available for cross-reference
exit_conditions: catalog_extractor.py parses tooling catalogs (Sandvik, Kennametal, Iscar, etc.)
Extracts tool specifications: geometry, grade, coating, application range
Parses recommended cutting data tables per insert/tool grade and workpiece material
Extracts tool ordering information: part numbers, ISO designations
Cross-references extracted tools against existing prism_data tool DB
Handles multi-page catalog layouts with repeated headers
Build passes
Tests pass

steps.instruction: Build catalog_extractor.py: detect catalog page layouts (tool images, spec tables, cutting data tables, application guides)
Extract tool specifications: geometry (nose radius, rake angle, clearance), grade (carbide, cermet, ceramic, CBN, PCD), coating (TiAlN, TiCN, CVD, PVD), application range
Parse cutting data recommendation tables: map tool grade x workpiece material -> speed/feed ranges, handle footnotes and condition modifiers
Extract part numbers, ISO insert designations (CNMG, WNMG, etc.), and link to tool geometry
Cross-reference extracted tools against prism_data tool DB, flag new tools not in DB, flag discrepancies in existing entries
Write tests using sample pages from major tooling catalogs

deliverables.description: Tooling catalog parser for specifications and cutting data
Tests for catalog data extraction

units.title: Knowledge Schema Mapping
exit_conditions: schema_mapper.py maps all extracted data to CC knowledge schema
Unified output format: KnowledgeEntry objects with source provenance
Deduplication: identical knowledge from multiple pages/sections merged
Provenance tracking: every entry links back to source PDF, page, region
Schema validation: all output entries pass JSON schema validation
Build passes
Tests pass

steps.instruction: Define KnowledgeEntry schema: type (parameter/practice/tool/material), value, units, conditions, confidence, source provenance (pdf, page, region, extraction_method)
Build schema_mapper.py: transform raw extractor output (params, practices, catalog data) into KnowledgeEntry objects
Implement deduplication: detect and merge duplicate entries from overlapping extractions (same parameter from table vs. text vs. chart)
Add provenance tracking: link every KnowledgeEntry to source PDF path, page number, bounding region, extraction method used
Add JSON schema validation for output entries, reject malformed entries with detailed error messages

deliverables.description: Maps extracted data to unified knowledge schema with provenance
KnowledgeEntry dataclass and JSON schema definitions
Tests for schema mapping and deduplication

units.title: Physics Validation of Extracted Knowledge
exit_conditions: physics_validator.py validates all extracted cutting parameters against prism_calc
Speed/feed values checked against material-appropriate ranges (Kienzle model)
Tool life values checked against Taylor model predictions
Power/force values checked against machine capability limits
Flagging system: VALID (within 20% of model), SUSPECT (20-50% deviation), INVALID (>50% deviation or physically impossible)
Invalid entries quarantined with deviation details, not stored in knowledge base
Validation report generated per PDF showing pass/suspect/fail counts
Build passes
Tests pass

steps.instruction: Build physics_validator.py: accept KnowledgeEntry objects, route to appropriate prism_calc model based on parameter type
Implement speed/feed validation: check against Kienzle model for given material, flag deviations with percentage and direction
Implement tool life validation: check against Taylor model for given conditions, flag unrealistic life predictions
Implement power/force validation: check against machine capability limits, detect impossible cutting force claims
Build flagging system: VALID/SUSPECT/INVALID classification with deviation details, quarantine INVALID entries
Generate per-PDF validation report: pass/suspect/fail counts, worst deviations, quarantined entries

deliverables.description: Physics-based validation of extracted parameters against prism_calc models
Tests with known-good and intentionally-bad parameter sets

units.title: Integration Tests with 20+ Real PDFs
entry_conditions: Full pipeline operational: ingest -> extract -> parse -> map -> validate
exit_conditions: E2E pipeline test: PDF file -> KnowledgeEntry objects with validation status
20+ real PDFs processed successfully (Machinery's Handbook sections, Sandvik/Kennametal catalogs, machine manuals, technical papers)
Table extraction accuracy >= 90% on test set
Parameter extraction recall >= 85% on annotated ground truth
Physics validation catches >= 95% of intentionally inserted bad values
No crashes or hangs on any test PDF
Pipeline processes average PDF (50 pages) in under 60 seconds
All extracted knowledge entries pass schema validation
Build passes
All tests pass

steps.instruction: Collect 20+ test PDFs: 5 tooling catalogs (Sandvik, Kennametal, Iscar, Walter, Mitsubishi), 5 Machinery's Handbook sections, 5 machine manuals, 5 technical papers/datasheets
Create ground truth annotations for 5 representative PDFs: manually mark expected tables, parameters, practices
Build E2E integration test: ingest PDF -> extract tables/charts -> parse parameters -> extract practices -> map to schema -> validate against physics -> output KnowledgeEntry set
Run accuracy metrics: table extraction accuracy, parameter recall vs ground truth, practice extraction completeness
Insert intentionally bad values into test PDFs, verify physics validator catches >= 95%
Performance test: measure processing time per PDF, ensure <60s average for 50-page documents
Stress test: process all 20+ PDFs sequentially and in parallel, verify no crashes, hangs, or memory leaks

deliverables.description: End-to-end integration tests for full PDF extraction pipeline
Accuracy and recall metrics against ground truth
Performance and stress tests
Ground truth annotations for 5 representative PDFs
20+ test PDFs from diverse sources

custom_checks: Physics validator catches >= 95% of bad values
All KnowledgeEntry outputs pass schema validation

deliverables_index.description: PDF loading, text extraction, OCR fallback
Technical parameter parsing and unit normalization

existing_leverage.description: Kienzle/Taylor models for physics validation of extracted parameters
1,944+ tool database for cross-reference of catalog extractions
Unified knowledge schema from integration testing phase
Validation framework for safety and completeness checks

scrutiny_config.escalation_rule: if pass 4+ finds CRITICAL, flag for human review
